member.name: T:Discord.WebSocket.BaseSocketClient
member.summary: Represents the base of a WebSocket-based Discord client.

member.name: P:Discord.WebSocket.BaseSocketClient.Latency
member.summary: Gets the estimated round-trip latency, in milliseconds, to the gateway server.
member.returns: An that represents the round-trip latency to the WebSocket server. Please note that this value does not represent a "true" latency for operations such as sending a message.

member.name: P:Discord.WebSocket.BaseSocketClient.Status
member.summary: Gets the status for the logged-in user.
member.returns: A status object that represents the user's online presence status.

member.name: P:Discord.WebSocket.BaseSocketClient.Activity
member.summary: Gets the activity for the logged-in user.
member.returns: An activity object that represents the user's current activity.

member.name: P:Discord.WebSocket.BaseSocketClient.Rest
member.summary: Provides access to a REST-only client with a shared state from this client.

member.name: P:Discord.WebSocket.BaseSocketClient.CurrentUser
member.summary: Gets the current logged-in user.

member.name: P:Discord.WebSocket.BaseSocketClient.Guilds
member.summary: Gets a collection of guilds that the user is currently in.
member.returns: A read-only collection of guilds that the current user is in.

member.name: P:Discord.WebSocket.BaseSocketClient.PrivateChannels
member.summary: Gets a collection of private channels opened in this session.
member.remarks:
This method will retrieve all private channels (including direct-message, group channel and such) that are currently opened in this session.
This method will not return previously opened private channels outside of the current session! If you have just started the client, this may return an empty collection.
member.returns: A read-only collection of private channels that the user currently partakes in.

member.name: P:Discord.WebSocket.BaseSocketClient.VoiceRegions
member.summary: Gets a collection of available voice regions.
member.returns: A read-only collection of voice regions that the user has access to.

member.name: M:Discord.WebSocket.BaseSocketClient.GetApplicationInfoAsync(Discord.RequestOptions)
member.summary: Gets a Discord application information for the logged-in user.
member.remarks: This method reflects your application information you submitted when creating a Discord application via the Developer Portal.
member.param: The options to be used when sending the request.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous get operation. The task result contains the application information.

member.name: M:Discord.WebSocket.BaseSocketClient.GetUser(System.UInt64)
member.summary: Gets a generic user.
member.param: The user snowflake ID.
member.remarks:
This method gets the user present in the WebSocket cache with the given condition.
Sometimes a user may return null due to Discord not sending offline users in large guilds (i.e. guild with 100+ members) actively. To download users on startup and to see more information about this subject, see .
This method does not attempt to fetch users that the logged-in user does not have access to (i.e. users who don't share mutual guild(s) with the current user). If you wish to get a user that you do not have access to, consider using the REST implementation of .
member.returns: A generic WebSocket-based user; null when the user cannot be found.

member.name: M:Discord.WebSocket.BaseSocketClient.GetUser(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets a user.
member.remarks:
This method gets the user present in the WebSocket cache with the given condition.
Sometimes a user may return null due to Discord not sending offline users in large guilds (i.e. guild with 100+ members) actively. To download users on startup and to see more information about this subject, see .
This method does not attempt to fetch users that the logged-in user does not have access to (i.e. users who don't share mutual guild(s) with the current user). If you wish to get a user that you do not have access to, consider using the REST implementation of .
member.param: The name of the user.
The discriminator value of the user.
member.returns: A generic WebSocket-based user; null when the user cannot be found.

member.name: M:Discord.WebSocket.BaseSocketClient.GetChannel(System.UInt64)
member.summary: Gets a channel.
member.param: The snowflake identifier of the channel (e.g. `381889909113225237`).
member.returns: A generic WebSocket-based channel object (voice, text, category, etc.) associated with the identifier; null when the channel cannot be found.

member.name: M:Discord.WebSocket.BaseSocketClient.GetGuild(System.UInt64)
member.summary: Gets a guild.
member.param: The guild snowflake identifier.
member.returns: A WebSocket-based guild associated with the snowflake identifier; null when the guild cannot be found.

member.name: M:Discord.WebSocket.BaseSocketClient.GetVoiceRegion(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a voice region.
member.param: The identifier of the voice region (e.g. eu-central ).
member.returns: A REST-based voice region associated with the identifier; null if the voice region is not found.

member.name: M:Discord.WebSocket.BaseSocketClient.SetStatusAsync(Discord.UserStatus)
member.summary: Sets the current status of the user (e.g. Online, Do not Disturb).
member.param: The new status to be set.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous set operation.

member.name: M:Discord.WebSocket.BaseSocketClient.SetGameAsync(System.String,System.String,Discord.ActivityType)
member.summary: Sets the game of the user.
member.param: The name of the game.
If streaming, the URL of the stream. Must be a valid Twitch URL.
The type of the game.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous set operation.

member.name: M:Discord.WebSocket.BaseSocketClient.SetActivityAsync(Discord.IActivity)
member.summary: Sets the of the logged-in user.
member.remarks:
This method sets the of the user.
Discord will only accept setting of name and the type of activity.
Rich Presence cannot be set via this method or client. Rich Presence is strictly limited to RPC clients only.
member.param: The activity to be set.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous set operation.

member.name: M:Discord.WebSocket.BaseSocketClient.DownloadUsersAsync(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Discord.IGuild})
member.summary: Attempts to download users into the user cache for the selected guilds.
member.param: The guilds to download the members from.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous download operation.

member.name: M:Discord.WebSocket.BaseSocketClient.CreateGuildAsync(System.String,Discord.IVoiceRegion,System.IO.Stream,Discord.RequestOptions)
member.summary: Creates a guild for the logged-in user who is in less than 10 active guilds.
member.remarks:
This method creates a new guild on behalf of the logged-in user.
Due to Discord's limitation, this method will only work for users that are in less than 10 guilds.
member.param: The name of the new guild.
The voice region to create the guild with.
The icon of the guild.
The options to be used when sending the request.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous creation operation. The task result contains the created guild.

member.name: M:Discord.WebSocket.BaseSocketClient.GetConnectionsAsync(Discord.RequestOptions)
member.summary: Gets the connections that the user has set up.
member.param: The options to be used when sending the request.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous get operation. The task result contains a read-only collection of connections.

member.name: M:Discord.WebSocket.BaseSocketClient.GetInviteAsync(System.String,Discord.RequestOptions)
member.summary: Gets an invite.
member.param: The invitation identifier.
The options to be used when sending the request.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous get operation. The task result contains the invite information.

member.name: E:Discord.WebSocket.BaseSocketClient.ChannelCreated
member.summary: Fired when a channel is created.

remarks.para: This event is fired when a generic channel has been created. The event handler must return a and accept a as its parameter.

member.name: E:Discord.WebSocket.BaseSocketClient.ChannelDestroyed
member.summary: Fired when a channel is destroyed.

remarks.para: This event is fired when a generic channel has been destroyed. The event handler must return a and accept a as its parameter.

member.name: E:Discord.WebSocket.BaseSocketClient.ChannelUpdated
member.summary: Fired when a channel is updated.

remarks.para: This event is fired when a generic channel has been destroyed. The event handler must return a and accept 2 as its parameters.

The original (prior to update) channel is passed into the first , while the updated channel is passed into the second. The given channel type may include, but not limited to, Private Channels (DM, Group), Guild Channels (Text, Voice, Category); see the derived classes of for more details.

member.name: E:Discord.WebSocket.BaseSocketClient.MessageReceived
member.summary: Fired when a message is received.

remarks.para: This event is fired when a message is received. The event handler must return a and accept a as its parameter.

The message that is sent to the client is passed into the event handler parameter as . This message may be a system message (i.e. ) or a user message (i.e. . See the derived classes of for more details.

example.para: The example below checks if the newly received message contains the target user.

member.name: E:Discord.WebSocket.BaseSocketClient.MessageDeleted
member.summary: Fired when a message is deleted.

remarks.para: This event is fired when a message is deleted. The event handler must return a and accept a and as its parameters.

It is not possible to retrieve the message via ; the message cannot be retrieved by Discord after the message has been deleted.
If caching is enabled via , the entity will contain the deleted message; otherwise, in event that the message cannot be retrieved, the snowflake ID of the message is preserved in the .
The source channel of the removed message will be passed into the parameter.

member.name: E:Discord.WebSocket.BaseSocketClient.MessagesBulkDeleted
member.summary: Fired when multiple messages are bulk deleted.

remarks.note: The event will not be fired for individual messages contained in this event.
remarks.para: This event is fired when multiple messages are bulk deleted. The event handler must return a and accept an and as its parameters.

It is not possible to retrieve the message via ; the message cannot be retrieved by Discord after the message has been deleted.
If caching is enabled via , the entity will contain the deleted message; otherwise, in event that the message cannot be retrieved, the snowflake ID of the message is preserved in the .
The source channel of the removed message will be passed into the parameter.

member.name: E:Discord.WebSocket.BaseSocketClient.MessageUpdated
member.summary: Fired when a message is updated.

remarks.para: This event is fired when a message is updated. The event handler must return a and accept a , , and as its parameters.
If caching is enabled via , the entity will contain the original message; otherwise, in event that the message cannot be retrieved, the snowflake ID of the message is preserved in the .
The updated message will be passed into the parameter.
The source channel of the updated message will be passed into the parameter.

member.name: E:Discord.WebSocket.BaseSocketClient.ReactionAdded
member.summary: Fired when a reaction is added to a message.

remarks.para: This event is fired when a reaction is added to a user message. The event handler must return a and accept a , an , and a as its parameter.
If caching is enabled via , the entity will contain the original message; otherwise, in event that the message cannot be retrieved, the snowflake ID of the message is preserved in the .
The source channel of the reaction addition will be passed into the parameter.
The reaction that was added will be passed into the parameter.
remarks.note: When fetching the reaction from this event, a user may not be provided under . Please see the documentation of the property for more information.

member.name: E:Discord.WebSocket.BaseSocketClient.ReactionRemoved
member.summary: Fired when a reaction is removed from a message.

member.name: E:Discord.WebSocket.BaseSocketClient.ReactionsCleared
member.summary: Fired when all reactions to a message are cleared.

member.summary: Gets the current connection state of this client.

member.summary: Gets a collection of direct message channels opened in this session.
member.remarks:
This method returns a collection of currently opened direct message channels.
This method will not return previously opened DM channels outside of the current session! If you have just started the client, this may return an empty collection.
member.returns: A collection of DM channels that have been opened in this session.

member.summary: Gets a collection of group channels opened in this session.
member.remarks:
This method returns a collection of currently opened group channels.
This method will not return previously opened group channels outside of the current session! If you have just started the client, this may return an empty collection.
member.returns: A collection of group channels that have been opened in this session.

member.summary: Initializes a new REST/WebSocket-based Discord client.

member.name: M:Discord.WebSocket.DiscordSocketClient.#ctor(Discord.WebSocket.DiscordSocketConfig)
member.summary: Initializes a new REST/WebSocket-based Discord client with the provided configuration.
member.param: The configuration to be used with the client.

member.name: M:Discord.WebSocket.DiscordSocketClient.SetStatusAsync(Discord.UserStatus)
member.example:
The following example sets the status of the current user to Do Not Disturb.
await client.SetStatusAsync(UserStatus.DoNotDisturb);

example.para:
The following example sets the activity of the current user to the specified game name.
await client.SetGameAsync("A Strange Game");

The following example sets the activity of the current user to a streaming status.
await client.SetGameAsync("Great Stream 10/10", "https://twitch.tv/MyAmazingStream1337", ActivityType.Streaming);

member.name: M:Discord.WebSocket.DiscordSocketClient.AddPrivateChannel(Discord.API.Channel,Discord.WebSocket.ClientState)
member.exception: Unexpected channel type is created.

member.summary: Fired when connected to the Discord gateway.

member.name: E:Discord.WebSocket.DiscordSocketClient.Disconnected
member.summary: Fired when disconnected to the Discord gateway.

member.name: E:Discord.WebSocket.DiscordSocketClient.Ready
member.summary: Fired when guild data has finished downloading.

member.name: E:Discord.WebSocket.DiscordSocketClient.LatencyUpdated

member.name: T:Discord.WebSocket.DiscordSocketConfig
member.summary: Represents a configuration class for .
member.remarks: This configuration, based on , helps determine several key configurations the socket client depend on. For instance, shards and connection timeout.

member.name: F:Discord.WebSocket.DiscordSocketConfig.GatewayEncoding
member.summary: Returns the encoding gateway should use.

member.name: P:Discord.WebSocket.DiscordSocketConfig.GatewayHost
member.summary: Gets or sets the WebSocket host to connect to. If null, the client will use the /gateway endpoint.

member.name: P:Discord.WebSocket.DiscordSocketConfig.ConnectionTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the time, in milliseconds, to wait for a connection to complete before aborting.

member.name: P:Discord.WebSocket.DiscordSocketConfig.ShardId
member.summary: Gets or sets the ID for this shard. Must be less than .

member.name: P:Discord.WebSocket.DiscordSocketConfig.TotalShards
member.summary: Gets or sets the total number of shards for this application.

member.name: P:Discord.WebSocket.DiscordSocketConfig.MessageCacheSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of messages per channel that should be kept in cache. Setting this to zero disables the message cache entirely.

member.name: P:Discord.WebSocket.DiscordSocketConfig.LargeThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets the max number of users a guild may have for offline users to be included in the READY packet. Max is 250.

member.name: P:Discord.WebSocket.DiscordSocketConfig.WebSocketProvider
member.summary: Gets or sets the provider used to generate new WebSocket connections.

member.name: P:Discord.WebSocket.DiscordSocketConfig.UdpSocketProvider
member.summary: Gets or sets the provider used to generate new UDP sockets.

member.name: P:Discord.WebSocket.DiscordSocketConfig.AlwaysDownloadUsers
member.summary: Gets or sets whether or not all users should be downloaded as guilds come available.

remarks.para: By default, the Discord gateway will only send offline members if a guild has less than a certain number of members (determined by in this library). This behaviour is why sometimes a user may be missing from the WebSocket cache for collections such as .
For more information, please see Request Guild Members on the official Discord API documentation.
remarks.note:
Please note that it can be difficult to fill the cache completely on large guilds depending on the traffic. If you are using the command system, the default user TypeReader may fail to find the user due to this issue. This may be resolved at v3 of the library. Until then, you may want to consider overriding the TypeReader and use
or as a backup.

member.name: P:Discord.WebSocket.DiscordSocketConfig.HandlerTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the timeout for event handlers, in milliseconds, after which a warning will be logged. Null disables this check.

member.name: P:Discord.WebSocket.DiscordSocketConfig.ExclusiveBulkDelete
member.summary:
Gets or sets the behavior for on bulk deletes.
If true, the event will not be raised for bulk deletes, and only the will be raised.
If false, both events will be raised.
If unset, both events will be raised, but a warning will be raised the first time a bulk delete event is received.

member.name: P:Discord.WebSocket.DiscordSocketConfig.GuildSubscriptions
member.summary: Gets or sets enabling dispatching of guild subscription events e.g. presence and typing events.

member.name: M:Discord.WebSocket.DiscordSocketConfig.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a default configuration.

member.name: T:Discord.WebSocket.ISocketAudioChannel
member.summary: Represents a generic WebSocket-based audio channel.

member.name: T:Discord.WebSocket.ISocketMessageChannel
member.summary: Represents a generic WebSocket-based channel that can send and receive messages.

member.name: P:Discord.WebSocket.ISocketMessageChannel.CachedMessages
member.summary: Gets all messages in this channel's cache.
member.returns: A read-only collection of WebSocket-based messages.

member.name: M:Discord.WebSocket.ISocketMessageChannel.GetCachedMessage(System.UInt64)
member.summary: Gets a cached message from this channel.

remarks.note: This method requires the use of cache, which is not enabled by default; if caching is not enabled, this method will always return null. Please refer to for more details.
remarks.para: This method retrieves the message from the local WebSocket cache and does not send any additional request to Discord. This message may be a message that has been deleted.

member.param: The snowflake identifier of the message.
member.returns: A WebSocket-based message object; null if it does not exist in the cache or if caching is not enabled.

member.name: M:Discord.WebSocket.ISocketMessageChannel.GetCachedMessages(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the last N cached messages from this message channel.

remarks.note: This method requires the use of cache, which is not enabled by default; if caching is not enabled, this method will always return an empty collection. Please refer to for more details.
remarks.para: This method retrieves the message(s) from the local WebSocket cache and does not send any additional request to Discord. This read-only collection may include messages that have been deleted. The maximum number of messages that can be retrieved from this method depends on the set.

member.param: The number of messages to get.
member.returns: A read-only collection of WebSocket-based messages.

member.name: M:Discord.WebSocket.ISocketMessageChannel.GetCachedMessages(System.UInt64,Discord.Direction,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the last N cached messages starting from a certain message in this message channel.

remarks.note: This method requires the use of cache, which is not enabled by default; if caching is not enabled, this method will always return an empty collection. Please refer to for more details.
remarks.para: This method retrieves the message(s) from the local WebSocket cache and does not send any additional request to Discord. This read-only collection may include messages that have been deleted. The maximum number of messages that can be retrieved from this method depends on the set.

member.param: The message ID to start the fetching from.
The direction of which the message should be gotten from.
The number of messages to get.
member.returns: A read-only collection of WebSocket-based messages.

member.name: M:Discord.WebSocket.ISocketMessageChannel.GetCachedMessages(Discord.IMessage,Discord.Direction,System.Int32)

remarks.note: This method requires the use of cache, which is not enabled by default; if caching is not enabled, this method will always return an empty collection. Please refer to for more details.
remarks.para: This method retrieves the message(s) from the local WebSocket cache and does not send any additional request to Discord. This read-only collection may include messages that have been deleted. The maximum number of messages that can be retrieved from this method depends on the set.

member.param: The message to start the fetching from.
The direction of which the message should be gotten from.
The number of messages to get.
member.returns: A read-only collection of WebSocket-based messages.

member.name: T:Discord.WebSocket.SocketGuild
member.summary: Represents a WebSocket-based guild object.

member.name: P:Discord.WebSocket.SocketGuild.MemberCount
member.summary: Gets the number of members.
member.remarks:
This property retrieves the number of members returned by Discord.
Due to how this property is returned by Discord instead of relying on the WebSocket cache, the number here is the most accurate in terms of counting the number of users within this guild.
Use this instead of enumerating the count of the collection, as you may see discrepancy between that and this property.

member.name: P:Discord.WebSocket.SocketGuild.DownloadedMemberCount
member.summary: Gets the number of members downloaded to the local guild cache.

member.name: P:Discord.WebSocket.SocketGuild.IsConnected
member.summary: Indicates whether the client is connected to this guild.

member.name: P:Discord.WebSocket.SocketGuild.Owner
member.summary: Gets the user that owns this guild.

member.name: P:Discord.WebSocket.SocketGuild.HasAllMembers
member.summary: Indicates whether the client has all the members downloaded to the local guild cache.

member.name: P:Discord.WebSocket.SocketGuild.IsSynced
member.summary: Indicates whether the guild cache is synced to this guild.

member.name: P:Discord.WebSocket.SocketGuild.AudioClient
member.summary: Gets the associated with this guild.

member.name: P:Discord.WebSocket.SocketGuild.DefaultChannel
member.summary: Gets the default channel in this guild.
member.remarks:
This property retrieves the first viewable text channel for this guild.
This channel does not guarantee the user can send message to it, as it only looks for the first viewable text channel.
member.returns: A representing the first viewable channel that the user has access to.

member.name: P:Discord.WebSocket.SocketGuild.AFKChannel
member.summary: Gets the AFK voice channel in this guild.
member.returns: A that the AFK users will be moved to after they have idled for too long; null if none is set.

member.name: P:Discord.WebSocket.SocketGuild.EmbedChannel
member.summary: Gets the embed channel (i.e. the channel set in the guild's widget settings) in this guild.
member.returns: A channel set within the server's widget settings; null if none is set.

member.name: P:Discord.WebSocket.SocketGuild.SystemChannel
member.summary: Gets the system channel where randomized welcome messages are sent in this guild.
member.returns: A text channel where randomized welcome messages will be sent to; null if none is set.

member.name: P:Discord.WebSocket.SocketGuild.TextChannels
member.summary: Gets a collection of all text channels in this guild.
member.returns: A read-only collection of message channels found within this guild.

member.name: P:Discord.WebSocket.SocketGuild.VoiceChannels
member.summary: Gets a collection of all voice channels in this guild.
member.returns: A read-only collection of voice channels found within this guild.

member.name: P:Discord.WebSocket.SocketGuild.CategoryChannels
member.summary: Gets a collection of all category channels in this guild.
member.returns: A read-only collection of category channels found within this guild.

member.name: P:Discord.WebSocket.SocketGuild.CurrentUser
member.summary: Gets the current logged-in user.

member.name: P:Discord.WebSocket.SocketGuild.EveryoneRole
member.summary: Gets the built-in role containing all users in this guild.
member.returns: A role object that represents an @everyone role in this guild.

member.name: P:Discord.WebSocket.SocketGuild.Channels
member.summary: Gets a collection of all channels in this guild.
member.returns: A read-only collection of generic channels found within this guild.

member.name: P:Discord.WebSocket.SocketGuild.Users
member.summary: Gets a collection of users in this guild.
member.remarks:
This property retrieves all users found within this guild.
This property may not always return all the members for large guilds (i.e. guilds containing 100+ users). If you are simply looking to get the number of users present in this guild, consider using instead.
Otherwise, you may need to enable to fetch the full user list upon startup, or use to manually download the users.
member.returns: A collection of guild users found within this guild.

member.name: P:Discord.WebSocket.SocketGuild.Roles
member.summary: Gets a collection of all roles in this guild.
member.returns: A read-only collection of roles found within this guild.

member.name: M:Discord.WebSocket.SocketGuild.GetUser(System.UInt64)
member.summary: Gets a user from this guild.

This method retrieves a user found within this guild.
This may return null in the WebSocket implementation due to incomplete user collection in large guilds.
member.param: The snowflake identifier of the user.
member.returns: A guild user associated with the specified ; null if none is found.

The options to be used when sending the request.
The audit log entry ID to filter entries before.

member.name: T:Discord.WebSocket.SocketReaction
member.summary: Represents a WebSocket-based reaction object.

member.name: P:Discord.WebSocket.SocketReaction.UserId
member.summary: Gets the ID of the user who added the reaction.
member.remarks: This property retrieves the snowflake identifier of the user responsible for this reaction. This property will always contain the user identifier in event that cannot be retrieved.
member.returns: A user snowflake identifier associated with the user.

member.name: P:Discord.WebSocket.SocketReaction.User
member.summary: Gets the user who added the reaction if possible.

remarks.para: This property attempts to retrieve a WebSocket-cached user that is responsible for this reaction from the client. In other words, when the user is not in the WebSocket cache, this property may not contain a value, leaving the only identifiable information to be .
If you wish to obtain an identifiable user object, consider utilizing which will attempt to retrieve the user from REST.

member.returns: A user object where possible; a value is not always returned.

member.name: P:Discord.WebSocket.SocketReaction.MessageId
member.summary: Gets the ID of the message that has been reacted to.
member.returns: A message snowflake identifier associated with the message.

member.name: P:Discord.WebSocket.SocketReaction.Message
member.summary: Gets the message that has been reacted to if possible.
member.returns: A WebSocket-based message where possible; a value is not always returned.

member.name: P:Discord.WebSocket.SocketReaction.Channel
member.summary: Gets the channel where the reaction takes place in.
member.returns: A WebSocket-based message channel.
